you making a ganache and well ganache is
delicious
often times it can be really pasty and
thick and not great to eat so today I'm
going to show you a hybrid method of
ganache custard method for making a
delicious tart filling so let's get
started to get started let me just show
you what I'm talking about so this is
kind of a standard tart or pie that's
made with a ganache filling and with an
equal ratio of cream and chocolate
usually what happens is you get
something that's really kind of stiff
and pasty and while it's tasty because
it's chocolate and cream it's not

that wonderful richness from the

I'm going to start with 1 cup of heavy
cream kind of a standard ingredient used
in making a chocolate ganache and I'm
going to heat this over a medium-low

forming around the perimeter of the pan
you don't want to over boil your cream
it might separate the cream the other

and I'm using 8 ounces of chocolate and
you want to make sure using a
high-quality chocolate here because this
is really the key ingredient and there
aren't really that many ingredients in

ingredients if you can find them so I'm
just chopping up this chocolate and I
like to use a serrated knife for this
because the teeth on the serrated knife
really help to chip the chocolate into
nice small pieces and that's really
important when making a ganache because
the smaller the pieces the easier and
more evenly the chocolate will melt with
the cream now I'm using a dark chocolate
this is a semi-sweet chocolate if you're
a fan
something a little bit more you know

nice and finely chopped and I'm gonna

fine pieces and now my cream is just

heat off and I'm going to pour this over
the chocolate and one thing guys you
want to make sure that you don't stir
this mixture yet let it sit for about a
minute to two minutes before giving this
a nice stir what that does is the hot
cream helps to melt the chocolate evenly
and then when you stir it there won't be
any little lumps of chocolate so this is
an important step let it rest for about
a minute all right so it's been about 2
minutes here you guys and now it is time
to mix the ganache together so I like to

everything should combine really nicely
because we've given the chocolate enough

while this is still a little bit warm
I'm going to add the remainder of my

that's why I'm adding the butter first
before my other ingredients it will help

so as I said before this is kind of a

of milk this is a quarter of a cup of

now this filling is different you might

is this kind of like chocolate cream pie
and the answer's no because chocolate
cream pie or puddings while they are
kind of custard a base they are

so it's not gonna be pasty or pudding

it's all mixed together and now I'm

sets with a lower temperature but it
doesn't get a broken or grainy texture
to it so a low temperature for a long
time is really ideal for custards and
this is going into the oven center rack
is always best for about 20 to 24
minutes until the mixture is set with a
